articles.title: Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Nepali Party Leader
articles.content:
Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Nepali Party Leader
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a condolence message from Jhalanath Khanal, chairman of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United MarxistÔºçLeninist) and ex-prime minister of Nepal, on Dec. 20 last year.
					At the news of the untimely demise of the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il I express profound condolences to the WPK and all the Korean people in grief over the loss on behalf of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist) and on my own, the message said, and went on:
					
					Comrade Kim Jong Il was a genuine patriot and a perfect leader who set an example for all the leaders of the world to follow.
					
					The message hoped the Koreans would overcome the sorrow with strength and advance the country, holding aloft the red flag of independence and development upheld by Comrade Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Tunisian President
articles.content:
Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Tunisian President
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences from Al Moncef Al Marzouki, president of Tunisia, on January 2 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The message said:
					
					It was with great sorrow that I received news that leader HE Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, passed away.
					
					At this painful moment I express condolences to Your Excellency and the Korean people on my own and on behalf of the government and people of Tunisia.
					
					Please accept, Your Excellency, the assurances of my highest consideration.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message on Jan. 2 from Algerian President Abdelaziz Bouteflika on becoming the supreme leader of the DPRK.
					The message said:
					
					Please accept my congratulations to you on becoming the supreme leader of your country and wish you great success in your responsible and noble work.
					
					I am convinced that the Korean people will continue advancing along the road of progress and prosperity by inheriting the cause of HE Kim Jong Il under your wise guidance.
					
					Availing myself of this opportunity, I affirm my firm will to boost the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between Algeria and the DPRK for the mutual interests of our two friendly peoples and the world peace.
					
					Please accept, Your Excellency, the assurances of highest consideration.

articles.title: Hundreds of Millions of People in World Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Hundreds of Millions of People in World Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency released a detailed report on Friday to register in the history of mankind the unforgettable days when hundreds of millions of people around the world mourned in humblest reverence the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					When an important report on the untimely demise of Kim Jong Il was announced at noon of Dec. 19, 2011, the whole world was wrapped in mourning over the great loss, the detailed report said, and went on:
					
					Just after they heard the sad news, the Chinese party and government sent a message to the Workers' Party of Korea and the government of the DPRK to express their deepest condolences and heartfelt sympathy to all the Korean people.
					
					The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a condolatory message from Russian President Medvedev expressing his deep condolences and a similar message from former U.S. President Carter.
					
					During the mourning period more than 3 000 condolence messages came from heads of party, state and government, political parties and social organizations and high-ranking officials of political, public, military and economic circles in at least 120 countries, including China, Russia, Cuba, Syria, Cambodia, Nepal, Ethiopia, Nicaragua and Mexico, and representatives of international bodies, Juche idea study organizations and friendship and solidarity organizations.
					
					Wreaths were sent to the bier of Kim Jong Il by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, the State Council of China, the National Committee for the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference and the Central Military Commission of the CPC.
					
					Laid at the bier of Kim Jong Il and his smiling portrait displayed at Kim Il Sung Square of the DPRK and his portraits at DPRK missions abroad were more than 4 100 wreaths and floral baskets carrying deep reverence of heads of party, state and government, political parties, institutions and organizations and personages of many countries.
					
					Governments, political parties, institutions and organizations of different countries, international organizations and personages issued statements one after another on the passing of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Memorial services of various forms took place in many countries and at international organizations.
					
					Incumbent and former heads of state and governments, representatives of heads of state, party leaders, delegations of parties, governments, parliaments and social organizations, diplomatic envoys and personages of different social standings paid condolatory visits to DPRK missions in relevant countries and at international organizations.
					
					A large number of prominent figures, including the chairman of the Italy-Korea Cultural Association and the president of the "Korea Association" of the United States and diplomatic envoys of different countries sent e-mails, FAX, letters and telephone calls to the DPRK missions to express deep condolences.
					
					Cuba and Thailand declared morning periods.
					
					Flags were hoisted at half-mast at the United Nations Headquarters, the UN Office at Geneva and other buildings of UN organizations. The World Food Programme hoisted its flags at half-mast in the garden of its building as well as on its roof, for the first time in its history out of the usual practice.
					
					Various countries and regional bodies held memorial services for Kim Jong Il in solemn atmosphere after forming their mourning committees.
					
					Even a country which has no diplomatic relations with the DPRK took a step of suspending the planned live-shell firing and missile launching drill as an expression of condolences.
					
					At least 10 000 media of more than 150 countries and regions promptly reported about the events of mourning over the demise of Kim Jong Il and gave special write-ups to them every day, breaking the precedent in reporting about mourning the death of any state leader.
					
					On Dec. 19 and 20, two days alone, TVs of 100 odd countries aired special programs on his demise.
					
					In Russia 150 odd leading news services, newspapers, radios and Internet homepages reported those mourning events more than 3 500 times.
					
					Xinhua news, Central TV, People's Daily and other media in the capital and localities of China reported in detail about the mourning situation.
					
					Not only media but also political and public personages of many countries and international organizations recognized Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the WPK and the people of the DPRK, as the great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche and praised his greatness while praying for the immortality of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Industrial Establishments
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Industrial Establishments
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on Friday made field survey of the Tongrim Mining Machine Plant and the Tongrim Electric Appliances Factory.
					At the machine plant he acquainted himself in detail with the production of processing shops Nos. 1 and 2 and convened a consultative meeting of officials concerned.
					
					At the meeting he stressed the need to step up the modernization of the plant through a dynamic drive for pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology.
					
					He concretely organized the work for relevant sectors to supply enough raw and other materials needed for production at the plant.
					
					Then he visited the electric appliances factory.
					
					After touring several shops and production processes of the factory, the premier discussed with officials the detailed matters arising in increasing production and took relevant measures.
					
					Prior to the field survey, he toured the third commodity exhibition at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1. He organized the work to produce more quality light industrial products that suit the public taste and are appreciated by the public.

articles.title: Mass Rallies Held in Localities of DPRK to Vow to Implement Tasks for This Year
articles.content:
Mass Rallies Held in Localities of DPRK to Vow to Implement Tasks for This Year
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Mass rallies took place in North Phyongan, South Hwanghae, Ryanggang and North Hamgyong provinces and Rason City of the DPRK on Saturday.
					The participants vowed to carry through the decision of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, the joint calls of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the militant tasks laid down in the joint New Year editorial as well as to respond to the letter of the South Hamgyong provincial working people. 
					
					Reporters and speakers called on all sectors and units to perform miracles and innovations and take the lead in the on-going general offensive, true to the last instructions of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Officials and working people in the field of the light industry should ensure the full capacity operation of all light industrial factories and produce in larger amounts quality goods which would cater to the people's tastes and are welcomed by them, thus contributing to improving the people's livelihood, they said.
					
					They also urged officials and working people in the field of agriculture to accept advanced farming method, properly choose high-yielding seeds and fully promote the farming with the use of organic fertilizer, thus remarkably increasing overall agricultural production.
					
					Intellectuals should raise higher the flame of the industrial revolution in the new century and the flame of Hamnam (South Hamgyong Province) to further develop the agricultural science and technology suited to the DPRK's specific conditions and thus contribute to the present general onward advance by intelligence and technologies, they urged.
					
					They called upon all the party members and other working people to unite behind the dear respected Kim Jong Un and carry on the dynamic drive to glorify this year as a year of proud victory and prosperity to be recorded in the glorious history of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					Attending the rallies were officials of local party and power bodies and working people's organizations, working people and youth and students.

articles.title: Cha Cholli, Commander of Kanggye Volunteer Army
articles.content:
Cha Cholli, Commander of Kanggye Volunteer Army
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Cha Cholli was active as the commander of the Kanggye volunteer army against the Japanese invaders in the early 20th centaury.
					When the Japanese imperialists forcibly dissolved the Kanggye military unit in summer of 1907, he, who had been a hunter, organized a volunteer army with other hunters and patriotic-minded people in the area to fight against the invaders and destroy their agencies.
					
					He took the volunteers to northeast China in autumn of 1910 and joined in the independence army to continue the anti-Japanese fight. 
					
					Cha met with President Kim Il Sung in 1927 in Fusong when he came to the area with an art propaganda squad during the winter vocation.
					
					In his reminiscences "With the Century" President Kim Il Sung recollected that Cha Cholli formed a volunteer army in Kanggye and fought against the Japanese invaders and that his nickname Cholli means covering 250 miles a day.

articles.title: Song Popular among Korean People
articles.content:
Song Popular among Korean People
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The song "We Will Never Forget Those Days" reminds the people of leader Kim Jong Il's revolutionary life.
					During the arduous march Kim Jong Il, responsible for the destiny of the nation, made uninterrupted field guidance tours for the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the people.
					
					After the demise of President Kim Il Sung, the news items about Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities reached about 1 700.
					
					He provided field guidance to all parts of the country and inspected many army units.
					
					The song reflects the history of his Songun (military-first) leadership in the rigorous period.
					
					One day Kim Jong Il, recollecting the period, said that the song was very good and that it fully contained his feelings.
					
					The Korean people are determined to remain faithful to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un carrying forward Kim Jong Il's revolutionary cause.

articles.title: Bean Native to Korea
articles.content:
Bean Native to Korea
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Bean, one of the principal crops worldwide, is native to Korea.
					The Korean nation had cultivated beans of semi-agricultural species evolved from a wild species from 6 000 years ago and Korean subspecific beans from 4 500 years ago. 
					
					Burnt beans were found out in the Odong relics in Hoeryong City, North Hamgyong Province and the Namgyong relics in Samsok District, Pyongyang. The discoveries go to prove that the Korean people have reared beans throughout the country and used them in their diet from several thousand years ago.  
					
					Beans of semi-agricultural species were discovered in the country in Juche 61 (1972). They are believed to date back to some 6 000 years ago. 
					
					According to historical records, Chinese people began raising beans imported from Korea 2 700 years ago and Japanese people did the same 2 000 years ago. Europeans began cultivating beans in the modern times. 
					
					Korea was also the first in the world to develop bean food and bean processing technique.

articles.title: Phenomena Witnessed in Mourning Days (1) Bears Seen on Road in Winter Day
articles.content:
Phenomena Witnessed in Mourning Days (1) Bears Seen on Road in Winter Day
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- At around 12:00 December 23, 2011, workers of the Taehung Youth Hero Mine saw three bears on a road when they were coming back from a mourning site after expressing deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					The bears, believed to be a mother and cubs, were staying on the road, crying woefully. 
					
					Bears usually have a deep sleep in cave or under fallen tree in thick forest in winter days. So it was unusual that they came out to a road in the daytime. Moreover, the road was what the leader had taken for his field guidance tour.
					
					The witnesses said it was as if the animals were wailing over his death.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Call for Opening Gates of National Reunification
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Call for Opening Gates of National Reunification
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Minjok Sibo, newspaper of overseas Koreans published in Japan, on Sunday carried articles contributed by personages of overseas Koreans organizations on the New Year.
					Kwak Tong Ui, chairman of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, recalled that last year all Koreans waged a dynamic struggle to uphold and implement the June 15 joint declaration, a milestone for reunification, and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it, and achieve independent reunification of the country.
					
					This year the Koreans overseas are facing an important task to put an end to the south Korean authorities' policy of confrontation with the DPRK and open the gates of national reunification under the banner of the "By the Korean nation itself" whose ideal is national independence and the great national unity, he said.
					
					Rim Min Sik, secretary general of the Joint Secretariat of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, said the Koreans should achieve the reunification of the country by the concerted efforts of Koreans and common prosperity in one and the same country so that they may lead a happy life all together.
					
					He called on the Koreans overseas to pool efforts to take the lead in the movement for national reunification.
					
					Ro Kil Nam, representative of Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper of Koreans in the U.S., underscored the need to achieve national independence and peaceful reunification at the earliest possible date.
					
					To this end, all the Koreans at home and abroad should firmly join hands and display the tremendous might of the great national unity irrespective of ideology and ism, political view and religion, class and stratum, he added.
					
					Choe Yong Suk, chairperson of the European Solidarity of Korean Nation, expressed hope that democratic forces would surely emerge victorious in "the National Assembly" and "presidential" elections slated to take place in south Korea this year to contribute to bringing earlier reunification.
					
					Kim Ji Yong, chairperson of the south Korean Democratic Women's Society in Japan, underlined the need to dynamically advance this year, too, to achieve national reunification by the concerted efforts of Koreans on the basis of the achievements and experience gained  last year.
					
					Mun Se Hyon, chairman of the south Korean Youth League in Japan, called on the young Koreans in Japan to make redoubled efforts to put spurs to the movement for independence, democracy and reunification.

articles.title: NDC Statement Supported by Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
NDC Statement Supported by Koreans in Japan
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, Thursday made public a statement denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for committing thrice-cursed treason during the mourning over the great loss to the nation. 
					The statement recalled that the DPRK National Defence Commission in its statement on Dec. 30 last year declared that it would never deal with the Lee Myung Bak group who rubbed salt into the wounds of the compatriots bitterly grieving the big loss to the nation.
					
					It went on:
					
					The DPRK has consistently called for advancing together along the road of reunification, peace and prosperity and proposed wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations and strived for their realization. 
					
					However, the south Korean puppet authorities responded to the proposal with pro-U.S. sycophancy and confrontation with fellow countrymen and intensified war moves. The group, though aware that all Koreans were overcome with bitter sorrow at the great loss to the nation, did not express condolences but suppressed south Koreans of  various social standings desirous of mourning it by hook or by crook. 
					
					There is nothing to expect from these anti-reunification forces. Reunification can never be achieved and the destiny of the nation will be put at peril as long as they stay in power. 
					
					We together with all compatriots at home and abroad fully support the statement of the DPRK National Defence Commission which is entirely just as it fully reflects the will of the fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Kim Jong Il's Instruction for National Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Kim Jong Il's Instruction for National Reunification
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The joint calls of the Central Committee and Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and the joint New Year editorial called for implementing the instructions of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for national reunification to the letter, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a bylined article. 
					All the Koreans at home and abroad should turn out in the struggle for implementing their instructions for national reunification, the article urges and goes on:
					
					Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, set forth by Kim Il Sung, as the three charters for national reunification. It was a manifestation of his unbounded loyalty and firm patriotic will to carry out the behest of Kim Il Sung without fail.
					
					The three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the DFRK are the great charters for national reunification which comprehensively deal with the undying achievements of Kim Il Sung in leading the cause of national reunification over half a century and his precious experience.
					
					The five-point policy for great national unity serves as a complete book for national unity as it inherited Kim Il Sung's idea of great national unity and the exploits performed by him and developed them in depth. It reflects Kim Jong Il's firm will and noble virtue to join hands with those who value the sovereignty and dignity of the nation and sincerely love the country and nation and advance in the same patriotic ranks for reunification. 
					
					The three charters for national reunification, the five-point policy for great national unity, the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration serve as banners of struggle common to the nation and it is the earnest instruction of Kim Jong Il to implement them to the letter. 
					
					Standing in the van of the great advance for independent reunification is the dear respected Kim Jong Un, identical to Kim Jong Il.
					
					The cause of independent reunification will have a bright prospect and the nation a rosy future only when all Koreans remain true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un, united close around him.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak's reckless remarks in his recent "special New Year address on state policy" are nothing but ridiculous jargons let loose by the blind unable to see the reality of the DPRK witnessed and admired by the whole world and rigmaroles made by psychopath hell-bent on confrontation of systems. Minju Joson Saturday observes this in a bylined commentary. 
					It is quite natural for the service personnel and people of the DPRK to renew their pledges to take a thousand-fold revenge on the Lee group who rubbed salt into the wounds of the compatriots bitterly grieving the big loss to the nation, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					As already known, during the mourning period the DPRK decided not to receive foreign mourners delegations but said it was ready to receive all mourners groups from south Korea. So it provided every convenience, keeping overland road leading to Kaesong and direct air route open. It also offered the conservative authorities an opportunity for condolatory visit and warned that the group of traitors' behavior of totally disallowing even the expression of condolences under the pretence of "division of public opinion", "infringement upon principle" and "conflict inside the south" would have a catastrophic impact on the north-south relations. 
					
					The peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula have not been achieved not because of the lack of "a window of opportunity" but because of the Lee group of brutal gangsters. Therefore, the Lee group should be sternly punished in the name of the Korean nation for the peace and stability of the peninsula. 
					
					In a word, Lee Myung Bak revealed his true colors as a traitor to the nation through his "special New Year address". There is no way for Lee to get out of the deepening crisis and self-destruction as he violated ethics and moral laws. 
					
					The world will witness how the Lee group will meet its ruin.

articles.title: Probe into Truth about GNP Bribery Urged
articles.content:
Probe into Truth about GNP Bribery Urged
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the opposition Democratic United Party in south Korea at a press conference on Jan. 5 demanded the clarification of the truth about the bribery committed by a lawmaker from the "Grand National Party" (GNP).
					He recalled that Ko Sung Dok, a legislator from the GNP, received enveloped money from a candidate for its chairman before its congress in the period of the 18th-term "National Assembly." 
					
					He ridiculed the GNP, saying it is the party which allows even its chairmanship to be bought.
					
					He deplored irregularities and corruption are being committed by confidants of the chief executive one after another. 
					
					He stressed that this case should not be glossed over but its truth be clearly probed.

articles.title: Dissolution of GNP in S. Korea Urged by Opposition Party
articles.content:
Dissolution of GNP in S. Korea Urged by Opposition Party
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the opposition United Progressive Party of south Korea in a commentary on Thursday demanded the dissolution of the "Grand National Party", a corrupt political group.
					The confession made by Ko Sung Dok, lawmaker from the GNP, brought to daylight the despicable true colors of the ruling party, the commentary noted, and continued:
					
					As a matter of fact, it is not secret that bribery was rampant within the political camp during every election.
					
					Nobody would think the man who bought the post was the only man disclosed.
					
					The ruling party which allows its chairmanship to be bought has no reason to exist any longer, the commentary observed, holding that the GNP should not make any reform but be disorganized at once.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Immortal Feats Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Immortal Feats Praised by British Organization
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on Dec. 30 last year posted on its Internet homepage an article praising the undying feats of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					The idea and intention of Kim Jong Un precisely mean the idea and intention of leader Kim Jong Il and the former's mode of leadership is the greatest mode of leadership advancing the revolution and construction according to the idea and intention of the latter, the article said.
					
					It is thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Un that the sovereignty of socialist Korea and the people's safety are being firmly defended and the DPRK is demonstrating its dignity and might as an invincible military power, it noted.
					
					Kim Jong Un is working heart and soul to translate into reality the noble socialist ideal of Kim Jong Il, it stressed.
					
					The service personnel and people of the DPRK will defend and glorify the undying revolutionary feats of Kim Jong Il generation after generation, holding him in high esteem forever under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, it said.
					
					Kim Jong Il's sacred revolutionary career and undying feats will throw eternal rays on the history of the Korean nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, it noted.

articles.title: Statement of DPRK NDC Supported by British Organizations
articles.content:
Statement of DPRK NDC Supported by British Organizations
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- British organizations expressed support for the statement of the DPRK National Defence Commission in which it declared it would settle accounts with the Lee Myung Bak group to the last as it committed thrice-cursed crimes against the nation that grieved over the great loss.
					The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a joint statement on Dec. 30 last year said the statement of the DPRK NDC dealt a blow at the imperialists and the world reactionaries who vociferated there can be a "change" in the DPRK.
					
					Recalling that the south Korean puppet group hurt all Koreans overcome with great sorrow over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il and refused to allow individuals' mourning in south Korea and the dispatch of mourners groups, the joint statement branded this attitude as evil acts contrary to elementary ethics and morality.
					
					It expressed support for the statement of the NDC of the DPRK that it would never deal with the Lee Myung Bak group.
					
					It called on all the adherents to the Juche idea and the Songun idea to resolutely protect the DPRK from the vicious moves of the world reactionaries and the south Korean puppet group.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Praised by Russian Internet Magazine
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Praised by Russian Internet Magazine
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Russian Internet magazine "Liv Zurnal" posted an article titled "20 years shining with victory and glory" on Dec. 31 last year on the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					The army and people of the DPRK hailed Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA on December 24, 1991, the article said, and continued:
					
					Kim Jong Il laid down the principle of Songun and bolstered the defence capability of the country in every way.
					
					The political and ideological, military and technological might of the KPA has grown stronger under his wise guidance.
					
					His preeminence, braveness and military leadership art have been proved by history and recognized by the world public over the past 20 years, it noted, and went on:
					
					He made ceaseless long journeys for field inspection to mix with service personnel.
					
					His untimely demise is a great loss not only to the Korean people but to progressive mankind.
					
					Kim Jong Il who devoted his whole life to the prosperity of Korea and the socialist cause will live forever.

articles.title: Korean People Will Accomplish Revolutionary Cause of Juche: Nepali Political Party Leaders
articles.content:
Korean People Will Accomplish Revolutionary Cause of Juche: Nepali Political Party Leaders
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- C. P. Mainali, general secretary of the C.C., Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), Pushpa Kamal Dahal, chairman of the C.C., Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist), and Jalanath Kanal, chairman of the C.C., Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), met with the DPRK ambassador to their country between Jan. 1 and 3.
					C. P. Mainali said that the great HE Kim Jong Il was the distinguished thinker and theoretician who developed in depth the Juche idea onto a new high level and the great leader of the revolution who firmly defended socialism of Juche by pursuing the Songun politics as required by the era and history.
					
					The C.C., Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) is convinced that the Korean people will accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, he noted.
					
					Pushpa Kamal Dahal expressed belief that the DPRK will certainly attain its goal under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, extending solidarity to the just cause of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government and people.
					
					Jalanath Kanal said that the feats Kim Jong Il performed in leading the party, army and people of the DPRK will be everlasting.
					
					The Korean people's cause of socialist construction and national reunification are sure to be accomplished as they are led by Kim Jong Un, he added.

articles.title: Fire Brigades Urged to Enhance Their Role in China
articles.content:
Fire Brigades Urged to Enhance Their Role in China
Beijing, January 6 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, Chinese minister of Public Security, called for enhancing the role of the fire brigades. 
					Speaking at a recent enlarged meeting of the party committee of fire-fighting department of the Ministry of Public Security, he said fire brigades at all levels should fully implement the decision of the State Council for the improvement of fire-fighting activities and modernize themselves.
					
					They should also increase their fire-fighting capacity and provide good conditions of fire fighting.

articles.title: China's Vice-premier Calls for Improving Financial Management
articles.content:
China's Vice-premier Calls for Improving Financial Management
Beijing, January 6 (KCNA) -- China's vice-premier referred to the tasks to be fulfilled by the financial sector at a national round-table talk on financial affairs held recently. 
					Li Keqiang underscored the need for financial officials to give importance to serving people, improve the financial management in a scientific way, increase incomes and economize expenditures.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Building Sports Power
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Building Sports Power
Beijing, January 6 (KCNA) -- China's state councilor called for turning the country into a sports power.
					Liu Yandong, at a national meeting of sports department directors held recently, said sports officials should step up the building of a sports power, deeply aware of their historic mission and responsibility.

articles.title: CPC Pays Importance to Work with Veteran Party Members
articles.content:
CPC Pays Importance to Work with Veteran Party Members
Beijing, January 6 (KCNA) -- The Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) recently issued a notice calling for making sympathetic visits to party members leading an indigent life and veteran party members and cadres during the New Year's Day and the spring festival.
					The notice said that it is a good tradition of the CPC and an important duty of party organizations at all levels to take care of those people. 
					
					It stressed the need for all the regions and domains to be deeply aware of the importance of this work and make the party's deep concern reach them in time.

articles.title: Cuba's Success in Child Healthcare
articles.content:
Cuba's Success in Child Healthcare
Havana, January 6 (KCNA) -- Cuba ended 2011 with an infant mortality rate of 4.9 per thousand live births and seven provinces reported figures below the national average, according to the Ministry of Public Health on January 3.

articles.title: Vietnam's Rubber Exports Increase
articles.content:
Vietnam's Rubber Exports Increase
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Vietnam pocketed 3.1 billion U.S. dollars from about 800 000 tons of rubber exports in 2011, a high record that posted an increase of 2.2 percent in volume and over 31 percent in value year-on-year, the Vietnam Rubber Association (VRA) reported on Wednesday.
					Currently, Vietnam has about 740 000 hectares of rubber plantations, mainly located in southeastern provinces.

articles.title: Indonesia's Measure to Eradicate Poverty
articles.content:
Indonesia's Measure to Eradicate Poverty
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Indonesia's Public Welfare Minister Agung Laksono said on Wednesday that the government expected to see poverty rate reduced to between 11 to 11.5 percent this year, or lower than 12.37 percent last year.
					The government said it expected to see poverty rate reduced between 8 to 10 percent by 2014.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Philippines, Pakistan, Britain
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Philippines, Pakistan, Britain
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Landslide in a province of the Philippines on Thursday left 16 dead and about a hundred missing.
					A rescue operation is underway on the spot.
					
					Sind State of Pakistan was hit by heavy rain, causing flood.
					
					It left 520 dead, 1 180 others wounded as of Jan. 4. It destroyed about 1.6 million dwelling houses and killed more than 116 500 domestic animals.
					
					Strong wind jolted several regions of Britain on Jan. 3, causing damage.
					
					160km per hour wind, accompanied by snow and rain, caused casualties and cut electric power supply to about 70 000 households.
					
					Roadside trees were rooted out to cut off traffic on roads, suspend railway service and close ports.

articles.title: Spanish Unemployment Rate Continues to Climb
articles.content:
Spanish Unemployment Rate Continues to Climb
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Spain ended the year 2011 with around 4.42 million people out of work, the highest level since 1996, according to figures released Tuesday and published by the Spanish Ministry of Employment and Social Security.
					The figures recorded a rise of 1 897 during December last year, whereas the yearly growth stood at 322 286, up by 7.86 percent from 2010.

articles.title: Boeing to Cut More Than 2 000 Employees in Kansas Facility
articles.content:
Boeing to Cut More Than 2 000 Employees in Kansas Facility
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Boeing company on Wednesday announced that it plans to close its massive defense plant in Wichita, Kansas before the end of 2013.
					The announcement said its 2 160 employees would lose their jobs at the Kansas facility.

articles.title: One in Five Greeks Lives below Poverty Line
articles.content:
One in Five Greeks Lives below Poverty Line
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Now in Greece more than 850 000 households with over 2.2 million people faced poverty already, which came out as a serious problem of its society, while more than three million Greeks, or one quarter of the population live in fear of poverty or social exclusion, according to the annual report of the Greek Statistical Authority on Wednesday.

articles.title: 5.1-Magnitude Quake Hits Japan
articles.content:
5.1-Magnitude Quake Hits Japan
Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.1 on the Richter scale jolted near the east coast of Honshu on Thursday.
					The epicenter, with a depth of 20.10 km, was initially determined to be at 38.77 degrees north latitude and 142.24 degrees east longitude.

articles.title: Russia Stages Navy Drill in Mediterranean Waters
articles.content:
Russia Stages Navy Drill in Mediterranean Waters
Moscow, January 6 (KCNA) -- A flotilla of the Arctic Sea Fleet of Russia staged the two-day military drill in the Mediterranean on Monday and Tuesday. 
					In the drill fighters and helicopters of the flotilla practiced their aeronautics by carrying out dozens of sorties.

articles.title: Iran Not to Give up Uranium Enrichment Activities
articles.content:
Iran Not to Give up Uranium Enrichment Activities
Tehran, January 6 (KCNA) -- Spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of Iran Ramin Mehmanparast said Wednesday that Iran will never give up uranium enrichment activities. 
					"The nuclear issue of our country is totally peaceful and is a basic right of our nation," he said. 
					
					He stressed that there is never a talk about giving up "peaceful" nuclear activities in Iran.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de condolencias del presidente tunecino
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de condolencias del presidente tunecino
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Maximo Dirigente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo coreano, recibio un mensaje de condolencias que le dirigiera el dia 2 el presidente de la Republica Tunecina, Al Moncef Al Marzouki, con motivo del fallecimiento del Dirigente         Kim Jong Il.
					La misiva sigue:
					
					Recibi con profunda tristeza la informacion sobre el deceso de Su Excelencia Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					En este momento tan doloroso, expreso pesame a Su Excelencia y al pueblo coreano en nombre mio y en el del gobierno y pueblo tunecinos.
					
					Reciba mi mas alta consideracion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente argelino
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente argelino
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- En relacion con que el vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Jong Un devino el Maximo Dirigente de Corea, el presidente de la Republica Argelina Democratica y Popular, Abdelaziz Bouteflika le dirigio el dia 2 un mensaje de felicitacion que sigue:
					Aprovecho esta ocasion para enviar mis felicitaciones a Vd. que devino el Maximo Dirigente de vuestro pais le deseo grandes exitos en su noble y responsable trabajo.
					
					Estoy convencido de que bajo su sabia orientacion, el pueblo coreano avanzara de continuo por el camino al progreso y prosperidad heredando la causa de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Le hago constar mi firme voluntad de fortalecer las magnificas relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Argelia y la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea para los intereses mutuos de los pueblos de nuestros dos paises amistosos y la paz mundial.
					
					Reciba mi mas alta consideracion.

articles.title: Entidad britanica elogia imborrables proezas de Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Entidad britanica elogia imborrables proezas de Kim Jong Un
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- La Asociacion de Estudio de la Politica de Songun de Gran Bretana divulgo el 30 de diciembre pasado en la pagina web un articulo de elogio a las imborrables proezas del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un. 
					La ideologia y el proposito de el  son iguales a los de Kim Jong Il, y su modo de direccion es la mas justa para llevar adelante la revolucion y la construccion segun el deseo del Dirigente, senala la nota. 
					
					Gracias a la direccion de Kim Jong Un, se defienden firmemente la soberania de la Corea socialista y la seguridad del pueblo y se manifiestan plenamente la dignidad y el poderio de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea como invencible potencia militar, apunta. 
					
					Prosigue que Kim Jong Un hace ingentes esfuerzos por realizar el noble proposito socialista del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Los militares y los civiles coreanos enalteceran al Dirigente Kim Jong Il y defenderan y glorificaran generacion tras generacion sus imborrables hazanas revolucionarias apoyando la orientacion del Maximo Dirigente, destaca.
					
					Bajo su guia, seran registradas para siempre en letras doradas en la historia de la nacion coreana la sagrada vida revolucionaria e imborrables proezas del Dirigente, concluye.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia disparate de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia disparate de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 7 de enero (ACNC) -- El disparate del traidor Lee Myung Bak hecho en el reciente  "discurso especial del Ano Nuevo" no pasa de ser  una sofisteria de un psicopata que ignora la realidad de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea admirada por todo el mundo y solo se entrega a la confrontacion de regimenes.
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este sabado y prosigue: 
					
					Es natural que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea juren vengarse mil veces del traidor que hizo sablazo en el alma doloroso de los connacionales por el gran duelo nacional.
					
					Como ya es conocido por todos, durante el periodo del gran duelo nacional, la RPDC decidio no recibir  a las delegaciones extranjeras de condolencias, pero si a todos los grupos de condolencias del Sur de Corea y abrio la via terrestre por Kaesong y la via aerea directa para ofrecer todas las comodidades.
					
					Tambien dio a las autoridades conservadoras la oportunidad de realizar la visita de condolencias, y  cuando la banda traidora nego totalmente hasta la expresion de condolencias bajo el pretexto de la "division de la opinion publica nacional", el "dano de principios" y las "discrepancias entre los habitantes surcoreanos" le advirtio que sus actos ejerceran la consecuencia catastrofica a las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					La paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana no se realizan enteramente debido a la banda traidora. Por lo tanto, para realizar la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana hay que sentenciarla rotundamente en nombre de la nacion.
					
					En una palabra, a traves del " discurso especial para el Ano Nuevo" el traidor Lee Myung Bak revelo por si mismo su naturaleza antinacional.
					
					La banda que pisoteo la etica y la moralidad no puede liberare de la agravacion de la crisis y la desesperacion de la derrota.
					
					El mundo vera claramente como se arruina la banda traidora surcoreana.
